modName: Animations for Statics_Clutter in Blender and 3ds Tutorial
summary: This tutorial shows you how to get animations into nif's using blender and 3ds
descriptionHtml:
Look into the Videos Tab for the Embedded Youtube Videos

Look at the Required Tab just below the Endorsments at the top of this page for hot links to the required mods by Anton.

*******

There are plenty of tutorials on getting custom animations on Characters through creating custom idles, when I tried to find a tutorial or tool to get basic animations on statics, such as opening a chest for the many new custom model resources on here and TES Alliance, I came up short.

Anton0028; aka Anton has created a number of tools to do just this, so first and foremost Big thanks to Anton for his great tools and all the help he has given me and the community.

For this tutorial you will need his Mesh Injector:

http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34226

Mesh Injector takes an .obj that you can create in any 3d program, preferably Blender, and to inject that mesh into a nif, without needing to use the Niftools exporter. While Niftools exporter are still the preferable method for simple things, Mesh injector is a must have for getting custom animations into the nifs.

You will also need Anton's Body Animator:

http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51351/?

It transfers the bone, skin and key data from Blender and 3ds and allows you to inject it into a nif.


Disclaimer:

This tutorial only covers getting the animations into nifskope; i'll eventually make tutorials for getting the animations in game, but it should be a simple process that you can figure out.

Also should be noted that if you're using 3ds max, the body animator script may function strangely which i address in the video. The Blender version is by far superior. So there's no reason not to use blender to animate, its free and simple to use.
